ai.summary: Lea Valley Walk is a 6 km moderate-length section in the UK, following river and parkland paths along the Lea. It can be enjoyed as a linear out-and-back or as a short loop, and provides a pleasant mix of riverside scenery, urban sections, and green space suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect mostly flat terrain with gentle undulations. The surface mix includes paved paths, compact gravel, towpath sections, and occasional grassy or dirt patches. Riverside and park areas may have wet or muddy spots after rain; sturdy footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast, as riverside paths can be slippery when wet. Stay on marked paths, beware of cyclists on towpaths, and watch for street crossings in urban stretches. Let someone know your plan and estimated finish time, and carry a phone with emergency contacts and a map.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn are the best seasons, with summer offering longer daylight and spring/autumn providing milder weather; winter can be cold and muddy.

seo.title: Lea Valley Walk – 6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a 6 km moderate hike along the Lea Valley in the UK. This route blends riverside towpath views with parkland paths and practical safety tips.
seo.h1: Lea Valley Walk – 6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
